description:
Hellsing follows the antiheroic vampire, Alucard, and a police girl-turned-vampire, Seras Victoria, two vampires employed by the vampire-extermination group of England, the Hellsing Organization. Slowly but surely, through their active duty, they find a new breed of vampires beginning to arise.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Noir
tags.description: Stylized as a cynical crime drama with low-key visuals.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

node.description:
__Place of Birth:__ Los Angeles, California, USA

An American voice director, script writer, voice actor, and former child actor. He is known for directing and writing many English language anime titles for New Generation Pictures, most notably R.O.D the TV and Hellsing. He is also co-directing BECK: Mongolian Chop Squad with Christopher Bevins for FUNimation. Jaffe has also written many articles and spoken as a guest lecturer at universities and libraries. 

(Source: Wikipedia)

American '80s hard rock band. Mr. Big is very popular in Japan. Richie Kotzen wrote the song "Shine" (Hellsing ending theme)

Band members:
Eric Martin – lead vocals (1988–2002, 2009-present)
Billy Sheehan – bass guitar (1988–2002, 2009-present)
Paul Gilbert – guitar (1988–1997, 2009-present)
Matt Starr - drums (2018-present)

Former member:
Pat Torpey – drums, percussion (1988–2002, 2009-2018)
Richie Kotzen – guitar (1999–2002)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/rollo_alfredo) | [Instagram 1](https://Instagram.com/alfredo_rollodub/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/rollou_insight/) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/alfredo.sa.54) | [Website](https://alfredorollovoz.wixsite.com/alfredo-rollo---psic)

Alfredo dos Santos Rollo, better known only as Alfredo Rollo, is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, psychologist, psychoanalyst, and psychodramatist. He is married to the voice actress [Melissa Garcia](https://anilist.co/staff/103053/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Lucifer Mornigstar (Lucifer)
- James "Jim" Halpert (The Office)
- Gideon Graves (Scott Pilgrim vs. The World)
- Lass Isolet (Grand Chase Classic and Grand Chase: Dimensional Chaser)
- Julian Solo / Poseidon (Saint Seiya: Soldiers' Soul)
- Dewey Finn (1st dub; School of Rock)
- Chuckie Sullivan (1st dub; Good Will Hunting)
- Marcus (Arcane)
- Stu Pickles (2nd voice; Rugrats franchise)
- Josh (Detroit: Become Human)
- Vic (Disney Universe)
- Cha Sung-Te (Big Mouth South Korean TV series)
!~

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiranokohta)

Starting his career first as a mangaka's assistant (self-described as "horrible" and "lazy" in said assistant position), and later an H manga artist, he went on to enjoy somewhat limited success with other relatively unknown manga titles such as Angel Dust, Coyote, Gun Mania and Hi-Tension. His first major success came with his manga series Hellsing, which got its start and was subsequently serialized in a monthly manga magazine, Young King OURs, towards the latter half of 1997.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/222835/)._
Adept in various fields related to computer graphics.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kakudou) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/角銅博之)

Hiroyuki Kakudou, also known as Hiroki Kudou, is a Japanese anime director. He is best known for directing the first two Digimon series.

Kakudou is a graduate of Tokyo University and has formerly belonged to Toei Animation where he learned to work as a director, and was also involved as a production assistant, storyboarder and director on episodes on series like Slam Dunk and Gegege no Kitarou.

Kakudou is currently a freelance director and a member of the animation production group "Group Ebisen" (グループえびせん).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/murahama)

After graduating from school he took social sciences at Otemon Gakuin University, where he belonged to the local SF club. During his time at university he participated in Daicon Film activities and after dropping out of university in 1987 he joined the former Daicon Film, now Gainax, where he participated as Production Manager in works such as Honneamise, Nadia and Top wo Nerae.

In 1992 he left together with Maeda Mahiro, Higuchi Shinji and Yamaguchi Hiroshi to establish a new studio, Gonzo, where he assumed the position of President and Representative Director. Currently he serves as Chairman of the Board and Representative Director at GDH.

Murahama left Gonzo on March 31, 2009 and launched a new company called Lambda Film on April 1, 2009, the same day that Gozo's parent company, GDH, absorbed Gonzo and adopted the Gonzo brand name for itself.

Murahama will serve as the representative director for Lambda Film's board of directors.

[Website](http://www.konaka.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamaki_nyx)

Chiaki J. Konaka is a Japanese writer and scenarist best known for shows such as [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Digimon Tamers](https://anilist.co/anime/874/) and [Texhnolyze](https://anilist.co/anime/26/). He is also known to be the creator of Ultraman Gaia, as cited by Tsuburaya Productions.

Konaka's serious works generally have a dark, psychological tone. As a Cthulhu Mythos writer, he tends to add Lovecraftian elements to his works.

"Chiaki J. Konaka" is a very unusual name, as Japanese names typically do not include middle names. Konaka states that the "J." evokes the "Christian" name "John", due to him being born to parents who were members of the Anglican Church, but he does not identify as Christian. He began using the "J." at the age of 12, when he began making 8 mm films; he patterned the style after Western names such as "Charles M. Schulz".

He has cited [Ghost Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/2596/) as his favorite screenwriting project.

[Website](http://www.konaka.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamaki_nyx)

Chiaki J. Konaka is a Japanese writer and scenarist best known for shows such as [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Digimon Tamers](https://anilist.co/anime/874/) and [Texhnolyze](https://anilist.co/anime/26/). He is also known to be the creator of Ultraman Gaia, as cited by Tsuburaya Productions.

Konaka's serious works generally have a dark, psychological tone. As a Cthulhu Mythos writer, he tends to add Lovecraftian elements to his works.

"Chiaki J. Konaka" is a very unusual name, as Japanese names typically do not include middle names. Konaka states that the "J." evokes the "Christian" name "John", due to him being born to parents who were members of the Anglican Church, but he does not identify as Christian. He began using the "J." at the age of 12, when he began making 8 mm films; he patterned the style after Western names such as "Charles M. Schulz".

He has cited [Ghost Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/2596/) as his favorite screenwriting project.
